The Digital Grand Tour

A World Made by Travel format_quote link

Giovanna Ceserani

In the eighteenth century thousands of northerners traveled to Italy for a journey of cultural and symbolic capital called at the time the Grand Tour. These travels were a formative institution of modernity, contributing to a massive reimagining of politics and the arts, of the market for culture, of ideas about leisure, and of practices of professionalism.

A World Made by Travel makes public the work of the Grand Tour Project, directed since 2008 by Giovanna Ceserani, Associate Professor of Classics at Stanford University. At the core of the project is the transformation of more than five thousand entries from the 1997 Dictionary of British and Irish Travelers to Italy 1701-1800 (compiled by John Ingamells from the Brinsley Ford Archive) into a dynamic research resource about these travelers’ journeys and lives. This digital volume includes access to this interactive database--, its raw data and documentation; chapters on the project’s history, rationale and meaning; a collection of original essays produced in working with the Grand Tour Explorer, as well as resources to bring this material to the classroom. This work shows the historical significance of eighteenth-century travel to Italy, and its persisting influence, in new light and with unprecedented granularity, and it showcases the possibilities of digital history approaches to produce original research, while making these new approaches accessible to researchers, the general public and students alike.

Thomas Jones, Lake Albano, 1777. Yale Center for British Art, Paul Mellon Collection

    A World Made By Travel

    Giovanna Ceserani

    format_quote link

    A World Made by Travel is a digital publication and it integrates dynamically function and content. Clicking on the table of contents’s sections titles here to the left will show the subsections--chapters and essays--and in turn clicking on each of these will pull them up for reading. You can leave all subsections of the table of contents open, or close each by clicking on its title again; to download the full table of contents as a PDF click on the download sign in the top right corner. Once reading has taken you to scroll further down, to get back to the table of contents click on the arrow sign at the bottom. Below this arrow sign is a red auburn that opens up in a new tab the Grand Tour Explorer, the interactive database that is part and parcel with the book. The red auburn hyperlinks in the text also click to open up in new tabs the relevant sections in the Grand Tour Explorer. The golden yellow hyperlinks instead open to relevant sections within the text of A World Made by Travel itself. There are no page numbers in this digital publication but when you hover on any paragraph you will see its number, alongside signs to cite and link the paragraph. The download sign seen when hovering next to chapters' and essays' titles and in the pop up version of data images and their captions, allows you to access PDF version of all this content for ease of print. All citations and PDF versions include reference and copyright information for A World Made by Travel.
